text: A single daisy stands in a vase in an empty kitchen.
OLIVER FIELDS clicks on the light to the closet. He looks the rack of his parents' clothes. He begins to put some in a box marked "home", some in a b marked "thrift".

Oliver enters the bathroom and flushes bottle after bottl pills and liquids down the toilet. Next he struggles as h looks over the old toothbrush, hairbrush, all the bottles tubes besides the sink. He stares for a beat, then throws them all away.
Oliver hauls trash outside, adding it to a very large pil bags. An older Jack Russell Terrier, ARTHUR, follows him.

Oliver and Arthur sit on the office floor surrounded by papers, boxes, books and trash bags. He finds a photo of FIELDS in an open Jean jacket, no shirt, it's attached to personal ad application which he begins to read.

head_text.subj: EXT. LARGE EMPTY PARKING LOT NIGHT

text: In the dark, OLIVER FIELDS has a tape recorder and microphone, he follows ANDY as he excitedly prepares, a g of friends looks on.
Okay. Is it on? (recorder)
Yeah yeah.
This is for our friend Hal Fields. Hal. We love you.

Andy quickly lights a rack of large fireworks, they shoot into the night and explode - smoke - more explosions - everyone's laughing. Oliver looks up at the fireworks, recording the sounds, happy. BOOM, BOOM, BOOM, BOOM, BOOM.
Oliver has packed his car, he leans down to Arthur.
You're coming to live with me now. Arthur looks at him.
This is my car. Arthur hops in.
Oliver's car drives down Sunset boulevard.
Oliver and Arthur enter, he's carrying a box, his house i dark and lonely.
Oliver enters his dining room, Arthur in tow.
This is the dining room where people come and eat sometimes. The dog listens intently. Oliver moves on, the dog follow
Oliver and Arthur enter the living room.
This is the living room.
Oliver looks around, the dog looks with him.
We see the door open revealing Oliver and Arthur continui their tour.
That's the bathroom. The dog looks.
Arthur lays next to Oliver in bed. Unable to sleep, Olive looks to the ceiling.

head_text.subj: STILL BLACK AND WHITE AND COLOR PHOTOGRAPHS OF THE SUN, T
STARS, YOSEMITE, GEORGE W. BUSH FLASH BY

text: This is 2003. This is what the sun looks like, and the stars, nature. This is the President.

head_text.subj: NOW PHOTOS OF THE SUN, STARS, NATURE, ETC. FROM 1955 FLAS

text: And this is the sun in 1955, and the stars, and nature, and cars, and phones, and movies, and the President. These are what pets looked like. These are fireworks. This was smoking.

head_text.subj: PHOTOGRAPHS, CROPPED IN ON FACES FROM 1955, VERY FAST

text: This is what it looked like when people kissed...

head_text.subj: FAST SEQUENCE OF FACES FORM 1955 LAUGHING

text: ...When they were happy...
...When they were sad.

head_text.subj: FAST SEQUENCE OF MARRIAGE PHOTOS FROM 1955

text: My parents got married in 1955.
He was a museum director - she fixed up old houses.

head_text.subj: STILL PHOTO OF A BABY BEING BORN

text: They had a child, and they stayed married for 44 years...

head_text.subj: CIGARETTES, THEN LIVE ACTION CLIP FROM THE TELETUBBIES, A

text: ...Until she died in their bed, after four months of cancer and eating French toast for every meal and watching the Teletubbies everyday and confusing white straws for her cigarettes and skipping back and forth through time inside her head.
Hal fields sits on a couch, in a purple sweater, looking camera, struggling for words.
Six months later, my father told me he was gay. He had just turned 75.
I'm gay. Same camera angle, Hal still looking into camera we jump to him wearing a robe.
I always remember him wearing a purple sweater when he told me this but actually he wore a robe.
I'm gay. Same angle, we continue to jump cut through Hal talking t camera, each cut in different clothes, and with each cut line has a different inflection.
I'm gay. Jump cut, new outfit.
I loved your mother, but, uh... now I want to explore this side. Jump cut, new outfit.
I don't want to be just theoretically gay, I want to do something about it. New outfit and inflection.
...I want to do something about it... New outfit and inflection.
...I want to do something about it.
A live action "portrait" of Hal, looking into camera, fir in old clothes, then jump cut to new all black outfit.
He changed all his clothes.
The camera moves through a large group of men and streame gathered for Los Angeles Pride event.
He got a boyfriend, Andy, a physical trainer who was also studying for his professional pyrotechnic license. Camera lands on Hal beaming with pride, his arm around An who looks into camera and says.

Since I came out to my father, he never speaks to me. That's why I've been always attracted to older men. Hal and friends laugh warmly at Andy. We cut to live acti "portraits" of a priest, a therapist, the Primetimers, hi movie-night club, and the large L.A. Pride group, all loo into camera. OLIVER V.O. He found an out gay priest to guide him spiritually. He saw a therapist for the first time. He joined the Primetimers. Movie night. Los Angeles Pride, and then...
We see Hal's living room, empty of furniture in the morni light. OLIVER V.O. Four years after he came out, he died in this room...

Oliver enters, followed closely by Arthur. Oliver walks through the kitchen - Arthur follows him. Oliver walks through the living room - Arthur follows. Oliver makes a circle through the house - Arthur follows. Oliver sits, looking down at Arthur.
Look, its lonely out here, so you'd better learn how to talk with me. Arthur's face looks up at him filled with a dog's love an words.
While I understand up to 150 words - I don't talk. Oliver leans down, pushing his head into Arthur's.
I know. I know.
Camera follow's Oliver down a long corridor.
Oliver sits as HAL lays in a coma on a ventilator. The ro is dark, Oliver uses a flashlight to quietly read to his father.

QUICK CUTS. A nurse opens the shades. A DOCTOR and two nu stand over Hal, everyone's nervous. Hal is struggling wit all the tubes down his throat. Oliver is trying to help h breathe, talking into his ear. Oliver is ushered out of the room. The nurse draws the curtain. MOMENTS LATER: Oliver sits with Hal, now off the ventilat but still very weak and disoriented. Oliver coaches his breathing.
Calm. Calm, calm breaths. Hal coughs.
It's the middle of the night, Hal is connected to many I. in both arms, still disoriented, he's tangled up in the tubes, trying to pull them out of his arms. He wakes up Oliver.
Oliver! Please help me with all these ropes. Oliver rushes and helps him.
Pop, Pop, stop -- you're gonna hurt yourself. A NURSE quickly enters and helps hold down his arms.
Mr. Fields, we're going to have to secure your arms again. She puts his hands in restraints, Oliver helps.
You two married?
No, Pop.
Why not? She's great. The nurse smiles, embarrassed, and continues with her job
She's a great nurse in the hospital, we don't really know her, you're very high on drugs.
You always have some very good reason, haven't you?
No, Pop, I just don't want to be like you and mom. (aside to the nurse) Thank you...

IN THE KITCHEN: We see 10-year-old Oliver watching his mo GEORGIA and father kiss quickly, politely, and then his father leaves quickly. Hal remains in silhouette through shot. DIFFERENT DAY, IN OLIVER'S BEDROOM: Oliver watches Hal an Georgia kiss, and Hal leave - more like a performance tha anything real. DIFFERENT DAY, IN PARENT'S BEDROOM: Oliver watches Hal an Georgia kiss and Hal exit, quick and dry. 10-year-old Oliver studies them each time.
DIFFERENT DAY, OLIVER'S BEDROOM: Georgia quickly opens th door and finds Oliver drawing.
Oliver! He turns and Georgia shoots him with her finger, Oliver f to the ground.
Olly, you can do better. He gets up and she shoots him again - He falls more dramatically, knocking his head on the floor.
That's good. His mom looks at him affectionately.
Oliver walks Arthur across a lit field, towards the dog p
Everywhere dogs and their people are playing. Oliver and Arthur sit on a bench like two humans. Oliver watches the action, Arthur stares at Oliver.
Go have your own experiences with your own people. I'll be right here... Arthur stays by Oliver's side.

I'm a human. I'm not a dog. And you're a Jack Russell, that's a breed. Your personality was created by this guy John Russell, a hunting enthusiast, in the 1800s. And he bred your ancestors to have stamina and courage for the hunt. You think you're just you, and you want to chase the foxes, but other people planted that in you years ago.

Now, somewhat arbitrarily, you are considered very cute by us humans, and we keep breeding you not to chase foxes, but to be cute, and we put you in movies and television shows, and you, you're chasing tennis balls cause there as close to a fox as you're going to get. Arthur stays by Oliver's side.

CU on Oliver's hands as he draws a T-shirt that reads: "My personality was created by someone else and all I got this stupid T-shirt." Reveal that Oliver is in a design office. LIZ, 30's enter they IMPROV hellos. JUMP CUT thru a series of Oliver's drawings. A speech bub that reads: "A fair amount of failures." He draws portrai of girls with dates: "Ellen O. 1984-1988" -- "Julie P. 19 1989" -- "Liz B. 1993 - 1995" -- "Lynette I. 1995" -- "Amanda Y. 1996-2000" -- "Yuki H. 2000" -- "Christina S. 2001" -- "Michelle M. 2001-2003" Oliver stops drawing, lost in his thoughts...
In the dark I.C.U. room, Hal is still attached to many I. Oliver is helping Hal look at a book of Japanese rock gar with a flashlight.
Want me to read this? I found it in your books.
Yeah, alright. Give me the flashlight. Oliver opens it, they look at a few pages together, photo serene gardens.
Nice.
Oh, that's nice.
Hal keeps peeking at a bouquet of flowers in the corner o the room. Hal takes the flashlight from Oliver and guides to the flowers.
Oh, Andy brought those for you.
Oh, yeah? Hal continues to direct the light across the room, we fol the circle of light as it moves a cross a wall landing on painting.
Oh, who did that painting?
Well, I don't know. Its just a painting on the wall. Hal continues exploring, Oliver's enjoying his father's curiosity, he lands on some photos displayed on the table
A--, and these?
They're just photos, Pop.
But how do they relate to the exhibit?

They're just personal photos. They're not art. Hal slowly moves the flashlight up the wall, across the ceiling to a strange assortment of fire detectors, sprinklers, sensors, all laid out against the acoustic ti ceiling. Hal points up. Oliver looks for a beat, then...
Uh, well that's the water sprinkler thing.
Well, its beautiful.
What is?
Putting the Japanese gardens there. It's just beautiful.
Oliver looks from the ceiling to the rock garden book. Th ceiling and the gardens look the same. Oliver is moved by Hal's confusion. ANDY, 45-years-old, physical, boyish, st into the room.
Hal.
Andy! Andy gets on the bed opposite Oliver. He gives Hal a big on the lips. Hal glows. Oliver backs away slowly. Andy pi up Hal's hand, turns it palm up and presses his face into
I brought something for you. Oliver watches from outside the room as Andy excitedly pu a portable tape player out of his bag.
We made a recording for you.
Oh, God. Andy pushes play, on the recording we hear Andy's voice:
This is for our friend Hal Fields. Hal. We love you. We hear voices HOOTING, and then large FIREWORKS, LAUGHTE and CLAPPING. Oliver watches his father's happiness from a distance.

CU on Oliver's hands drawing bright streaming colors of t fireworks. LATER: Oliver get's to his real work, pulling out a few 8 photos of a band "The Sads". There are some instructions record company letterhead - he is to do an album design f their new record - they want him to draw portraits of the three members. Oliver begins to do quick portraits of them based on the photo.
Jesus, Liz. Another band that wants portraits.
Well, at least it pays the rent.
You do something decent once, and that's all people ever want. JUMP CUT through the different portraits developing. It's what Oliver want's to do.
Elliott and Shauna let themselves in. Elliot grabs a stoo and sits down.
Hi Liz. Oliver continues to draw, as Shauna and Elliott try to ge his attention.
Oliver?
Yeah?
The pen is not your friend. The paper is not your friend. The party is your friend. We're your friends. Your friends are your friends.
Elliot is now dressed as a cop and Shauna as a large chic they are dancing with no music as Oliver sits on a couch depressed dressed as Sigmund Freud, complete with wig-bea glasses-pipe.
I got the skills... he's got the moves...
I got the moves... you've got the skills... 10/29/07 14.
Oliver, Elliott, and Shauna are leaving. Arthur can't bel he's being left behind. It's actually the first time they will separate.

Arthur, you haven't been invited to this party. You're gonna stay and look after the house. Oliver tentatively shuts the door, takes three steps, Art begins to howl. Oliver tries to ignore it, but stops agai He looks back at the house and the howling.
Arthur, victorious, sits in Elliot's lap in the front sea while Oliver drives and Shauna is squeezed in back in her chicken outfit.
You remember when Oliver was funny? And he could actually, like, talk, in complete sentences?
Funny? Funny? I don't think so Fun maybe, but not funny unless, like, serious is funny. Then he's' fucking hilarious. Elliot and Oliver laugh.
But, lovable. You are very lovable.
Yeah, very lovable.

Oliver carries Arthur, they all enter a costume party, ma their way through the crowd of people in all kinds of disguises, music blaring, Oliver slides into the less populated kitchen. A woman rushes up to Oliver, surprised see he has a dog.
So cute, does he do tricks?
His name's Arthur - he doesn't do tricks. In the background are a couple dressed as JULIAN and ETHE ROSENBERG, we see them observe Oliver and Arthur.
No? Arthur, SIT! Arthur promptly sits down. Oliver's totally surprised.
He's so cute. Shake! Arthur sticks out his paw. Oliver doesn't like seeing Art blindly perform.
Oh my god, he's so cute, I want him.
(in Freud accent) Does it make you feel powerful to order my dog around? Maybe give you a sense of power?
Oh, you're being a therapist! Freud!

Thanks, yeah. Very good. Oliver picks up Arthur and escapes the kitchen. The Rosenberg's are still watching. LATER... Oliver and Arthur sit in a chair next to a couch where a dressed as a witch, complete with green face and long bla hair, is lying back as if in a traditional analysis sessi

Well, I didn't ask for this. Who would ask for this? This color. This nose. This cheek, this chin. You know, this is my life. This isn't a story. This isn't a joke... Oliver is playing along, but he's really not emotionally ready for this party. He feels very far away.
Yeah.
I'm so glad you came, Doc. Just really good to get this stuff off my chest.

(in Freud accent) I'm sorry. Our time is up, uh... for this week. Thank you for coming in. The witch moves on. Oliver sits with Arthur in his lap, alone, lost in all th joviality. We see that the woman dressed as Julius Rosenberg is watc him. Just as Oliver is about to get up, she plops herself down onto the couch, ready for her session. OLIVER V.O. Oh, I was just- I was gonna take a break, actually. She pulls out a writing pad, oblivious. Oliver can tell s not going to give it up.
(back in accent) Well, I guess we should start with your mother. The woman writes on her notepad and shows it to Oliver: "Never had one."
Well then your father. She mimes shooting herself in the head and dying.
I don't understand. You can't talk? Is it a mental problem? Do you need analysis? She writes on her pad: "I have laryngitis"

That's a physical problem. She smiles at him, looks at him a little too long, Oliver more and more pulled in by her playfulness - she writes: "Why are you at a party if you're sad?" CU on Oliver, surprised and impressed by her observation.
I was doing such a good job of hiding it. How could you tell? Ethel holds up her notebook. She has drawn TWO EYES. Oliver's taken by her.
Clearly, I'm gonna need a drink. You? She smiles and nods.
You, stay here, yeah? Oliver moves to--
Elliot and Shauna are deeply engaged in conversation with someone dressed as a pickle and someone dressed as much l colorful chicken.
No, its just not a natural color for a chicken.
No.
(motioning to Shauna's
And look, you see what happens when you free yourself from the cage, walk away from the factory.
You just have no real color.
Oliver slips past, hands Arthur to Elliot. He scoops ice from the bucket and starts filling two cups.
Hey, hey.
Uh-oh, one. Uh-oh, two.
Two drinks.
What does that me--, one, two.
Well that's two, two people.
Two people. A girl and a guy?
Hopefully.
Yeah, wow, making moves. Oliver leaves Arthur in Elliott's arms.
Watch him OK? Oliver begins to leave his drinks. We see his POV of the woman dressed as Julius Rosenberg waiting on the couch. Oliver slips into one of his memories...
INTERCUT: The phone RINGS, wakes up Oliver, he turns on t light, answers the phone. PRE-CANCER Hal talks excitedly.
Hello?
Oliver?
Yeah.
I'm not sorry I woke you! I went to Akbar tonight.
You did?
Hal and his friends, BRIAN and ROBERT, make their way thr a crowded gay club. Hal is by far the oldest, and most excited, man there.
They had wonderfully loud music. In- sit, in-sit, in-sit. What kind of music is that?
Probably house music?
Hal gets a pad and pen to write this down.
"House music."
A bunch of Young Gay guys dance. Hal is on the side, danc by himself, hands in the air twinkling his fingers.
So did you meet anyone? At the packed bar, Hal drinks alone.
Young gay men don't go for older gay men.
Back to Oliver in bed, on the phone.
You have it easy.
Oliver snaps out of his memory. He makes his way through crowd and delivers the drink to her. He looks at her a li too intensely, then blurts out.

Would you like to dance? She happily nods yes. They walk to the dance floor, we th Oliver's going to be shy, but he breaks into a kinetic, angular, dance. She's surprised with us - she laughs, the have a good time.

JUMP CUT THROUGH THE NIGHT: Oliver, "Julius", Elliott and Shauna are talking to a magician. "Julius" picks a card, magician mixes it into the full deck, pops a card into th air, it is hers. Shauna and Elliott can see that Oliver's coming alive. LATER. They dance again, now they're sweaty, the dance floor's packed - it's the pinnacle of the party.
The party's winnowing down in the background - "Julius" a Oliver look at each other in the mirror for a beat, and t simultaneously take their wigs off, revealing their true selves.
Hello... Shes mouths a silent "hi"...
Can I give you my number? She pulls out her pad and pen and hands them to him.
Thanks. As he writes, Oliver spies Arthur sitting in the corner o the bathroom, staring directly at him.
Tell her the darkness is about to drown us unless something drastic happens right now. Oliver looks to her.
I feel bad dragging Arthur to the party. I should get home. It was really nice meeting you. She writes on her pad: "Au Revoir"
Au revoir. Yeah. He leaves.
Oliver and Arthur walk up the empty street - Oliver kicki himself for missing his chance with her. His phone rings.
Hello? ON THE OTHER END: Silence. A little breathing, the party background.
Is that you? BEEP.
One beep means yes? BEEP.
I've always wanted to have a phone call with someone who doesn't talk... BEEEEEEEEEEEEP.
You want to do something?
Now? BEEP.

Okay, I'm parked just right up the street. BEEP. They hang up. Oliver is filled with hope. CUT TO: "Julius" walking out into a pool of street light. They smile at each other, but don't say anything. They ge into his car.
Okay. You point - I'll drive. Oliver starts the engine. She points forward and they hea off. At the light she points left, he follows. Down the street she points right...
This way?
She nods. Oliver drives up on the sidewalk before the street, heads down it for half a block, then takes her ri We can hear them laughing.
Oliver, Arthur and the woman enter a very fancy hotel lob Oliver is impressed. She mime's giving him a tour but sti doesn't talk.
Oliver and the woman open the door and enter her suite. T look at each other nervously.
Nice place. They sit on her bed. She steals his pipe, put's it in her mouth -- writes on her pad and shows it to him.
Oh, my mother. My mother died five years ago.
(in a hoarse whisper) Oh merd.
Oh, you spoke.
I'm not supposed to. She writes and present him with a new question.
My father died two months ago, almost three. She looks at him with sincere empathy and surprise. Olive opened up, an now everything gushes out, he barely knows he's saying.
He, he was gay. She's very surprised.
He was gay the whole time they were married.
He came out after my mother died and, uh... he was 75 years old. There's a quiet moment of deep connection.

Sorry. She mouths "No" (don't say sorry). She reaches out and ge runs a finger across Oliver's brow and the outline of his face, he's so vulnerable, she lovingly/mischievously squi his face together and messes up his hair. Then she leans and they kiss for the first time - delicately.
Can we just sleep?
Sure, sure. They lay down, she takes his arm and pulls him into spoon her. He pulls the covers over them.
Oliver wakes, still in his clothes. ANNA is already up. S waves and Oliver smiles. Anna holds up her notebook: "Who are you?"
Oliver. She writes again: "Go to NY. Audition. Back Thursday."
How long are you here when you get back? Anna holds up one finger.
A year? Anna shakes her head and smiles. She gestures smaller.
A month? Right. And then?... She pantomimes a camera rolling, and herself acting.
You're filming here. Acting.
Oliver smiles as he interprets her gestures.
And after?... She makes a casual tossing motion with her hand.
Just somewhere else. Where? Anna only shrugs. She writes more, and tosses the notepad his lap. Oliver reads: "Can I see you again?" He's very happy.
Yes.
They walk down the long hallway, Oliver carries her bags, Anna holds onto Arthur's leash. Oliver reaches out and ho her hand. They stop and kiss - gentle and comfortable wit each other.
Oliver now alone with Arthur - heading home, he's happy. CU on his face as he remembers... REPEAT SCENE: Oliver and Anna's first kiss, tentative and delicate.
Oliver's POV: Hal and Andy kiss lovingly.
Oliver's POV: Andy comes up behind Hal doing the dishes, kisses him. Hal smiles very happy.
Oliver's POV: Andy kisses Hal in the Hospital.
Oliver and Arthur enter his home, much more alive than th last time we saw him come through the door.
Hello house, (Low voice) hello Oliver.
Oliver makes two piles of mail, one says Oliver Fields, o has a yellow forwarding sticker that says Hal Fields. The Fields pile is much bigger.

Jesus, Pop, you get so much mail. Oliver slows and stares at his father's magazine - The Advocate. Two attractive, shirtless men on the cover unde the title: America's Sweethearts. Oliver's lost in memory
Hal, its remarkable how well you've recovered from being on the ventilator.
Hal sit's on top of his hospital bed, wearing one of his black outfits, looking much healthier. A doctor sits on h bed, Oliver listens from the side.
But...?
The bronchoscopy revealed a mass about the size of a quarter. It is located in your lower right lung. CU on Hal taking this in.
I'm afraid the biopsy showed it's cancerous.
Uh-huh. I see.
It appears to have spread... to the large hilar lymph nodes in your chest and liver.

DOCTOR LONG (cont'd) With the already weakened state of your heart and lungs... As Dr. Long talks about treatments, Oliver drifts back fr the conversation, slowly retreating to a window in the fa corner, as we continue to hear Dr. Long speak, we see Oliver's thoughts, fixating on "a mass about the size of
... Surgery isn't possible given its location. We can start radiation treatments and see if you're strong enough for Chemo. You will be able to go home.

head_text.subj: SHOT OF A QUARTER ON BLACK
SHOT OF TWO DIMES AND A NICKEL

text: We cut back to Hal's face, stoically digesting the news.
Do you have any questions?
No. Thank you. As the doctor leaves. Oliver takes his father's hand.
I'm sorry.
Well, let's not rush out and tell everyone.
Andy?
No need to get him up a tree. Hal takes a moment and composes himself. In his eyes we c see that he knows there is an end to his life.
Can you read me something?
Hal hands Oliver his Advocate magazine, he begins to read from "Tough Guys Do Dance."

The Brazilian ballet star is already known not only as a skilled partner, but also as a gifted and versatile dancer, who adeptly fields roles ranging... Camera tracks out of the room, leaving the two men alone.

SERIES OF CU JUMP CUTS: We see Oliver's hands as he draws series of silhouetted figures hanging from trees, others happily beheaded, all with talking bubbles that say, "Let not rush out and tell everyone" JUMP CUTS: Oliver draws another severed head, then a woma smoking next to the words, "First lung cancer." JUMP TO LATER: Oliver tacks his drawings to the wall, loo at them. He looks down and pets Arthur, as we hear...
Yeah, he's fine. He sleeps on your bed.
But is he eating?
Hal sits on his bed fully dressed, Oliver is visiting.
Yeah, yeah, he's eating.
Oh God, I worry so much about-- As Andy enters, his hands mysteriously cupped together.
Oh here we are... Andy shows Hal his cupped hands.
What have you got in there?
A slug.
Oh, Andy, you can't bring that kind of thing in here.
Oh I can look. Andy flashes open his hands, revealing nothing. He snorts laughs.
Fuck you. Oliver watches with amusement. NURSE SOPHIA enters...
It's time for inspection... The nurse works her way between Andy and Hal to take his pulse.
Hello, Mr. Fields.
Hello. Andy feels interrupted, strangely hurt by the nurse. The nurse begins to take Hal's vital signs.
I'm Andy. Hal's boyfriend
I'm Sophia. Andy gets more and more upset.
You know, I have the right to be here as much as anyone else. Hal lovingly cuts him off, trying to ease the tension.
Go take a walk. Calm yourself. Andy walks out, feeling embarrassed and rejected.
What was all that?
Oh, Andy hasn't had it easy. Be nice to him. To everyone's surprise, Andy storms back in with a bouque flowers, dumps them on Hal's chest, kisses him triumphant and leaves again.
(knowing he stole them) Andy, where did you get these?

JUMP CUTS: Oliver helps a group of Hal's gay friends and get settled. They're jovial, they come with drinks and flowers, the room gets very full. Oliver hands out cups, offers wine, Andy lifts his paper cup and makes a toast.
Guys, guys, this is to us. Cheers. A NURSE suddenly enters.
Drinking's not allowed in the room. All the guys freeze.
Oh, it's not? She shakes her head no, the party stops, she leaves. Oliv instinctively polite, starts packing up their cups.
I'm sorry. Moans and complaints from the group.
No, no, no. She's a wonderful nurse. (he pauses a beat, then raises his cup again) Here's to health care. Hal swigs back his wine. They all laugh, grab their cups toast.
To health care! Hal looks happy, Oliver smiles but can't believe his dad.
What did you do with my father? He was so polite.
Oh, I invited him - but he never returns my calls. The guys drink merrily. Someone shoves a cup into Oliver' hand, pours him a drink.
Oliver, Elliott and Arthur are shopping in a very old and crowded used book store. Oliver picks up a stack of magaz as Elliott interrogates him.
Two, four, six, eight...
That's it? That's all you're gonna tell me?
I'm gonna meet her at her hotel again. You happy?
Yeah, I'm very happy. Are you happy? Oliver drops his books on the counter to check out.
(to shop owner) Here's eight... Turns to Elliot.
We haven't actually had a conversation yet, so, you know...
The three are now in Oliver's car.
You're thinking about her all the time.
And you know that because?
Because you're not talking about it. I know you. There's a pause, then the truth.
It's true. It's embarrassing. I'm 38 and falling for a girl again...
Georgia works at her writing table. Young Oliver, bored, watches her.
It's like I lost the instructions or I, I never had them... Young Oliver walks up to Georgia.
Where's Pop?
At the museum.
Is something wrong with you guys? Georgia is startled, she hides her feelings with humor.
What're you, in the FBI?
No.
The CIA?
No.
KGB? (Oliver shakes his head, no) SLA? (no) PTA? (no) BMW? Oliver sits silently.
There is nothing wrong with me and Pop. Georgia's mask breaks revealing sadness. Oliver can see i she can see he sees it. Georgia gets up and leads Oliver of the room.
C'mon.
They stand in front of his bedroom door.
When you feel bad, you go into a room and scream - loud as you want, for a minute or two, then it's out of you. It's called catharsis. She opens the door, pushes him inside, and closes the doo
Young Oliver pauses, confused in his room. He doesn't scr
He comes back out. Sheepish.
I don't feel like screaming... Georgia, never ruffled.
You will...
Oliver and Arthur watch from the car as Elliott gets a ca spray paint, heads to a blank wall across the street and sprays a large tag on a wall. He then runs back to the ca looks proudly at his work.
What the fuck is that?
L-E-IT, Elliot
Well, that's ridiculous.
I know! (Getting his criticism more) You're not very supportive.
Well, its just copying something someone did, like, 30 years ago in the Bronx.
Well yeah. I'm part of a tradition of civil disobedience, something bigger than myself. Oliver can't believe Elliott said that.
Elliott drives along-side Oliver who's walking with a spr paint can, terrified as he's never done this before. He tries to spray, nothing comes out.
How does it work?
Shake it, you have to shake it. Oliver shakes it awkwardly, then sprays across the wall:
Oliver runs back to the car, exhilarated.
What was that?
Historical consciousness... you know, something bigger than myself. Elliott scoffs.
Let's do it again. Elliott drives off. Oliver's coming to life.
Okay, but when you see her, don't tell her that you painted historical consciousness on the wall... WE SEE: more of Oliver's graffiti on different buildings:
Oliver exits his house alone, down his front stairs to th street. Halfway down, he hears now familiar sound of Arth barking and howling. Oliver can't believe it.
Anna is sitting on the bed, gently petting Arthur.

He's sweet. He misses your Dad. She stops. Gets up, nervous, and walks past Oliver into t next room. Oliver follows her in. They pause uncomfortabl Anna suddenly leans in and kisses him. Before it goes to far...
Maybe we, we could, um, just talk for a second.
Right. They awkwardly break apart. Anna goes to a chair, Oliver follows. While nothing has really been expressed between two, Anna seems to understand the problem.

Well, my name is Anna. You're worried you can't trust me because you don't know who I am. I get it. That makes sense to me. She falters, looks at him vulnerably. Oliver abruptly kis her. She pushes back. They pause. She traces his brow slo with her index finger, the way she did their first night.

text: The music carries us, they lie in bed, naked. Anna innoce leans over and takes Oliver's arm and bites down hard. He grimaces. She stops and kisses it, admiring her teeth mar She gets up, sits at a side table and finds her cigarette Oliver watches her. The music seems to bend and slow down, this continues as fall into memory...
CU on young Oliver's hand pushing on a record making the bending, slowing sounds.
Oliver, stop it. Oliver stands up bored, Georgia's in the connecting bathr getting ready to go out.
This music's old.
It's black, black music is the deepest cause they suffered the most, them and the Jews. Oliver plops down on the bed, listening to her.
In my next life I'm gonna marry a good hot blooded Jew - someone full of emotion.
I'm Jewish right? Georgia comes and sits with him, caresses his hair as she talks with him.

You're a quarter, I'm a half, your father's none. He has the least emotions, You'll have more emotions than him, but I'll have the most emotions. She likes that she has the most emotions. They head out.
You get to play chauffeur but just to the bottom of the hill.
10 year old Oliver's in the driving sear, Georgia smokes admires his handling of the car.
You're turning into a wonderful driver. Oliver's proud.

text: Oliver escorts Georgia up the large steps of the museum. crowd from an opening gathers at the top.

text: Georgia and Oliver approach a David Smith sculpture. Afte staring at it's angels for a beat, Georgia begins to do a angular modern-dance-pantomime of the sculpture, imitatin it's shapes with her body. Oliver locks up with embarrassment. A confused and concerned museum guard approaches.
Excuse me Mrs. Fields....
What? You're not allowed to interact with the art?
It's just that...
C'mon. Still embarrassed, Oliver takes Georgia's hand and walks away from the guard.
You too? You like being a good citizen?
No.
Anna's sits in her kimono. Oliver's buttoning his shirt.
Can you toss me my camisole. Oliver throws a sweater.
No, my camisole. She throws the sweater back at him. Oliver looks around helplessly. He grabs a flower out of a vase and hands it her.
Camisole? Anna laughs.
You don't know what a camisole is?
I was brought up by these animals and they didn't like questions. They're both smiling now.
They were very frowned upon. So I had to guess. Anna takes this in.
You can ask me anything.
Anything? CUT TO: Oliver and Anna at the window.
What's out there? She points.
That's a tree.
Yeah.
And cars.
Uh-huh.
Another building like this one.
Right.
People in the building like us. Half of them think things will never work out. The other half believe in magic. It's like a war between them. Oliver smiles. He moves away from the window.
How do you know so much about people?
Oh. Well, you have to learn how to read their faces. She climbs onto his lap, straddles him.
For example... here is mad. Anna passes her hand across her face, and she's "mad".
Happy... Her hand passes again and she's "happy".
Sometimes its just nothing.
Oh yeah? She points at her blank face.
This is nothing... And they are good at looking one way and being another way. Her playfulness is very meaningful to Oliver, he's in lov 10/29/07 39.

They walk through a caged-in freeway overpass - Oliver is carrying Arthur while blindfolding Anna with his hands. O this we hear the sounds of the quiet hotel room and an intimate conversation between them.
You don't know me. I like that.
No, that's not true.
Oh yeah?
Yeah, you have blonde hair that goes down to about here. You smoke in non-smoking rooms. Oliver is still covering her eyes, leading her to a certa point, the busy sound of the freeway fading up...

Okay, open your eyes... HIGH ANGLE on huge trucks and traffic racing just beneath Oliver and Anna's feet under the overpass. The trucks lay their horns as they pass, scaring and thrilling them. MOMENTS LATER: they walk alongside the LA river together, in arm, happy. The intimate conversation continues in voi over.
Oh yeah? You drive on the sidewalk. You were raised by animals. Sometimes you look very alone, like you just got here. They meet up with friends on the banks of the river.
Yeah, you see, you don't know me at all.
Oliver and Arthur are leaving, walking down the long hall together. Arthur seems to stop and look up at Oliver.
She's unlike any girl I've ever met.
Oliver stops and looks at Arthur.
Someone flashy walks into your life and you're just gonna fall for it?
Are we married yet?
No, uh, it doesn't work like that. There are other steps, it's complicated. They look at each other a beat and then walk on together.
I hope this feeling lasts.
Oliver is shaving Hal's face.
What happened with Michelle?
You know... I don't know.
She seemed great.
She was great.
Maybe you should take out a personal ad, where you explain your situation?
My situation?
Yeah, I mean, you want to be in a relationship but you can't stay in one.
That's your fatherly advice? Personal ads?
Well, a lot of people use them... I did.
What?
If Andy wasn't going to be monogamous, why should I be?
Jesus, Pop.
Jesus yourself.
Hal's friends hold up a hand-made "WELCOME HOME" sign in living room. Oliver helps Hal walk to his crew, Andy at t center holding Arthur.

Hello house (Answers back in deep voice) Hello Hal. Andy holds Arthur. Hal and Arthur kiss. They've clearly missed each other. JUMP CUTS: Oliver takes bottles of pills and syrups and inhalers out of a Sav-On bag. He makes a chart of the medicine, the dosage, and puts the pills in a dish. It's emotional job for him.
Oliver watches as Andy sneaks up behind Hal with his hand cupped closed. Hal turns and smiles.

It's a green caterpillar.
No, no, no, you don't have a green caterpillar.
Oh yeah I do.
Andy opens his hands to reveal he actually does have a gr caterpillar.
Oh my God. Gross! Oh, Jesus...
Andy puts the caterpillar down on the saucer of Hal's tea cup, gives him a big kiss, and starts to leave...
Hey, you going?
Yeah, Michael's in town.
Oh. Right. Andy waves goodbye and leaves. Hal is sad but covering it up. He catches Oliver watching.
I thought he was your boyfriend?
Well, at least I'm the number one boyfriend. Hal grimaces in pain, doubles over.
Pop.
Oh, my stomach.
Alright, come on. Come on. Oliver tries to clear the couch of books and dogs for Hal sit down.
Arthur, down.
Well, let's say, when you were little, you always dreamed of some day getting a lion? Oliver eases Hal down onto the couch.
And you wait and you wait and you wait and you wait and the lion doesn't come. Then along comes a giraffe. Oliver helps Hal get his feet up.
You can be alone or you can be with the giraffe.
I'd wait for the lion. Oliver grabs the oxygen tubes and puts them on Hal's face
That's why I worry about you. Hal looks at Oliver with love and concern.

CU on Oliver's hands as he writes "THE HISTORY OF SADNESS CUT TO him drawing an explosion with the caption: "EARTH BEGINS (SADNESS NOT YET INVENTED)". He draws a man and a woman with the caption: "FIRST COUPLE TO MARRY FOR WRONG REASONS." He draws a spilled glass - "INVENTION OF ALCOHO ANCIENT EGYPT." Oliver stops drawing, thinking of a conversation with his father. CUT TO: Hal on his couch (previous scene) talking Oliver.
You want me to be with someone like me. I like Andy cause he's not like me... he's fun.
Arthur runs down the hotel hallway, followed by Oliver, t come to a corner and Anna jumps out, scaring them, they l and continue on together. 10/29/07 44.
Oliver and Anna are in the overcrowded used book store we earlier. Oliver sees her down the aisle.
Hey, what did you get? She puts the cover of Liv Ullman's "Changing" over her fa Ullman's face on the cover becomes Anna's.
Liv Ullman. Very serious.
And I found this crazy book. She holds an old copy of THE JOY OF SEX in front of her f
That's kind of a classic American thing. Anna opens the book to a large drawing of a couple having sex.
Maybe we can figure out some classic American things to do. Oliver takes the book and flips through the pages.
Yeah, Like page 75?
Uh-huh.
Or 75 all the way through, through 80. LATER... Oliver, Anna and Arthur sit at the end of an aisle lookin a book on "Old Hollywood". The book has a photo of Louise Brooks from the Twenties.
Louise Brooks, star of silent screen... effectively banned from Hollywood in early Thirties, ended up working as a salesgirl at Saks Fifth Avenue.
Anna listens. Oliver turns the page, we see a photo of Veronica Lake.
Veronica Lake.
Oh I love her.
She was a pin-up model and a film star... Success was short-lived... series of broken marriages... She struggled with mental illness and alcoholism. She died of hepatitis at the age of 53.

All these actor stories end sad. I can tell you that already. It's not a good life. Oliver closes the book, they share a look, and something vulnerable. Anna changes the mood, pulls out The Joy Of S skips through the pages as she talks.
So. Now I want real Mexican food. She stops on an illustration she likes.
And I want to try page... 46.
Oliver, Anna and Arthur walk up to a typical L.A. Taco tr on the side of the street. There is nothing fancy looking about it.
No.
Yeah.
Really?
It's really good. JUMP CUT: They're sitting on milk crates by the truck, re to take their first bite, Anna dives in un-selfconsciousl we're not sure what she thinks.
What do you think?
It's so good. Oliver's so relieved.
It's good? Oh, I wasn't sure you'd like it.
Why?
You're an actress and staying in that fancy hotel. Anna can barely swallow her huge bite...
I like this place.
They lie on the bed, continuing their conversation, side side, looking up at the ceiling together.
I used to love hotels. But now I'm always in a new apartment or... in another hotel somewhere.
How do you keep hold of friends... or boyfriends?
It makes it very easy to end up alone - to leave people.
You can stay in the same place and still find ways to leave people. She reaches up with her hand, their fingers intertwine.
You are like that? Its what you do? Oliver nods yes. They know each other much better than ei one knew.
So we are the same?
Yeah, I guess so. The look to each other.
Thumps and loud 1920's music wakes Oliver in the middle o the night. He turns the lights on, discombobulated. He gets up, works his way through the dark house. Turning lights.
Pop?
Hal's awake, he's taken down dozens of books from a wall wall bookshelf. A huge physical task. MARIA a nurse is wi him. Oliver's dumbfounded.
Oh, did I wake you? Yeah. (Handing Maria some books) Thank you Maria. (to Oliver) And now that you're here, uh, would you please put those up there?
What are you--? Pop. What?
I'm reorganizing.
Prednisone makes you crazy.
I'm just not sleepy. I feel great.
Oliver and Hal are sitting at either side of his desk, Ar is in hal's lap. The sound from last scene bleeds over...
Pop, you should rest. Hal looks sick but energized, he shuffles his desk of pap
As soon as I finish these papers. Right, papers? (In a different voice) Right, Hal. As soon as you're done, you can rest. Oliver can only sit and worry.
Anna, Oliver and Arthur are walking in Elysian park, a vi of downtown behind them. Oliver's looking at her face, sh notices.
What?
Nothing, you're pretty.
No...
Yeah.
Jewish girls are not pretty. They can be "interesting", or cute, but not pretty.
You're kidding right?
That's what my mom told me.
She did not. Anna laughs. As Anna continues to explain, the sound begi to fade down...
No, you're right, this girl at school told me that. And I went home and my mom said, `Anna, who told you that? And Oliver's narration fades in over them walking...

This is what it looks like when Anna tells me about being Jewish in 2003. And when I tell her that my mother was Jewish. And then my father turned in his gay badge when my mother turned in her Jewish badge. And they got married in 1955.

Alright. Oliver begins to neaten a messy pile of books on top of a chair.

The chair's not gay. Obviously. Hal gets up and walks to the kitchen, his oxygen cannon c is attached to the pump behind him, stopping him short.

Okay, I'll clean it up. It's a little - yech. Andy walks out, Hal pours water into a kettle, in front o him on the window sill is the same vase from the first sc of the film, with some dead daisies in it.

Oliver and Hal walk amongst all the products. Hal wears h portable oxygen and grabs different kinds of papers, dump them in the basket Oliver holds.

They're in a new isle, Hal continues his march.

Me?
Please?
Andy's on an elliptical trainer, through a window we can Oliver approaching with the weight of the world on his shoulders. Andy see's him, can immediately sense that something is wrong.
Hey. Oliver approaches seriously, this makes Andy nervous, he stops his workout. Oliver tries to find his words.
You know that I tried to have sex with women?
Yeah?
Yeah. I wanted you to know I tried, it just, it didn't work.
Hey, I don't have a problem with gay guys.
Have you ever had sex with a man?
No.
I heard that if a man hasn't had sex with another man, he's always afraid of gay men. You know, they're a threat. Oliver's blown away by the logic.
I don't know Andy.

I didn't want you to feel threatened, I don't want to have sex with you. What I do, most people wouldn't even call it sex. Andy's relieved he got this off his chest, all tension is relieved for him, Oliver is just confused.
Okay, okay.
Hey... Andy gives Oliver a big sweaty hug. Oliver leaves.
Oliver enters as Hal's finishing the dishes.
I couldn't tell him.
That's okay.
No it's not. You can't hide this from him. He loves you.
For someone with so much relationship advice, you seem awfully alone. Oliver, angry but at a loss for words, takes the flower v and leaves, Arthur follows.
Oliver and Arthur exit a side door, go to a planter full daisies and cuts some for his mother's vase. He looks bac Arthur.
Just act natural. When he's not looking, we'll make a run for it, okay?

The three enter, the phone is ringing, Anna is staring at with dread. Oliver looks at her, he finally moves to pick up.
Don't, don't. It keeps ringing.

He's that bad? She picks up the phone, and gestures for Oliver to pick u the line next to him.
I'll be my dad, you be me.
(In a deep man's voice) Honey? She gestures again, Oliver picks up the phone on his side the bed. Anna turns away, he can only see her back across bed. He turns away too.
Oui? Anna continues to talk in a different voice.
C'est toi, cheri?
Oui Papa.
You never call me back.
You know, I can't stop thinking about, you know, about it. Doing it.
Doing what?
Killing myself. You are the only one I can tell that to. Oliver breaks role, turns around looks at her.
You should tell mom about that, not me. She just looks at him. Back into phone.
You are my girl. They hang up. She's embarrassed, she lightens the mood to out of this intimacy.
Now I have to kill you.
Just as it was going so well.
I know. I'm sorry. She tosses a pillow over his face and pretends to shoot h twice. She pulls the pillow back tentatively, he's smilin

Hey Oliver?

Okay. Oliver walks out and writes big letters across the billbo YOU MAKE ME LAUGH BUT IT'S NOT FUNNY. He makes his way back. Anna's not where she was, he looks finds her in the gangways between the two billboards with view to downtown below her.
C'est beau ici.
Yeah. He comes to her, wanting to get beyond the romance someho

(Gasps ironically) Really? She walks to him and puts her hands around his head, some it's more intimate and vulnerable now.

Oliver, Anna and Arthur walk down the hallway. Arthur bol ahead suddenly, getting free of Oliver, he runs to and OL MAN - wearing all black and looking just like Hal. Oliver runs up to stop Arthur.

Well...

Anna?

If this is too much, then we should just stop. Oliver gets up and starts to leave, Anna's surprised. She catches up with him puts her arms around him from behind.
Wait, wait. She forces him to stay there.
